metadata.title: CVE-2023-2176 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in compare_netdev_and_ip indrivers/infiniband/core/cma.c in RDMA in the Linux Kernel. The impropercleanup results in out-of-boundary read, where a local user can utilizethis problem to crash the system or escalation of privilege.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic-lpae - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-lowlatency - 6.3.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.3.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3.0-7.7').
linux-aws package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.3.0-7.7.1').
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
